title: Integrated STEM Inquiry-Based Project Design: Practical Problem-Solving Through Mathematical Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level mathematics fundamentals (functions, geometry, statistics) and basic engineering design concepts
context.additional_context: A process where current secondary teachers design and implement STEM integrated projects under conditions similar to actual classroom environments, utilizing simple smartphone-based digital tools

learning_goals: Develop three project ideas integrating mathematics, science, and engineering principles to solve real-world workplace problems

Within six months, learners can apply the five core elements of Inquiry-Based Learning (question generation, data collection, hypothesis formulation, experimental design, result analysis) to develop one STEM-integrated lesson design document. The design must meet the following criteria: (1) integration of at least three STEM fields, (2) inclusion of two or more inquiry activities, (3) development of a five-stage assessment rubric.
Utilize smartphone-based tools (e.g., spreadsheet apps, measurement apps) to collect and analyze data, then present mathematical modeling results
Diagnose and improve the STEM integration level of project outputs on a 4-tier scale (initial/developing/matured/integrated) through peer assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
